title: Turret Capital Launches "The Foundry": A Global Youth Innovation Platform to Shape the Future of Healthcare
description: Turret Capital is proud to announce the official launch of The Foundry, its global innovation platform dedicated to discovering, supporting, and nurturing the next generation of bold thinkers and problem solvers in healthcare. Rooted in Turret's mission to empower youth and advance education, The Foundry will serve as a launchpad for young innovators ready to make a lasting impact on the future of healthcare.
content:
NEW YORK, Aug. 12, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Turret Capital is proud to announce the official launch of The Foundry, its global innovation platform dedicated to discovering, supporting, and nurturing the next generation of bold thinkers and problem solvers in healthcare. Rooted in Turret's mission to empower youth and advance education, The Foundry will serve as a launchpad for young innovators ready to make a lasting impact on the future of healthcare.

To kick off this groundbreaking initiative, The Foundry is hosting its inaugural event: The Foundry Health Innovation Challenge 2025, a global online pitch competition that is open to all high school students (grades 9–12) from around the world. The Challenge is designed to engage students in real-world problem solving, equipping them with critical thinking skills, entrepreneurial mindset, and exposure to industry experts and mentors.

"The Foundry reflects Turret Capital's belief that the future of healthcare will be shaped by the creativity and courage of the next generation. This is our commitment to helping young people build, learn, and lead—starting today," said Daniel Chai, MD, Founder & Managing Partner of Turret Capital.
• Challenge: Identify an unmet need in healthcare and propose an innovative solution
• How to Compete: Submit a 3–5 minute video pitch and a pitch deck
• Team Size: Solo or teams of up to 3 members

As a firm deeply committed to advancing healthcare through early-stage innovation, Turret Capital sees a unique opportunity to invest not only in technologies—but in people. The Foundry will become a long-term global platform to identify and cultivate talent at the high school and college levels through competitions, mentorships, and educational programming.

We believe that innovation doesn't have to wait for a degree. The boldest ideas often come from fresh perspectives—and that's exactly what The Foundry is here to empower.

For more information, competition details, or to register, visit www.turretfunds.com/foundry
summary: Turret Capital has launched The Foundry, a global youth innovation platform dedicated to discovering, supporting, and nurturing the next generation of bold thinkers and problem solvers in healthcare. The initiative is set to kick-off with the first event, The Health Innovation Challenge 2025, which is open to all high school students from around the world. This competition aims to engage students in real-world problem solving and train them with critical thinking skills, entrepreneurial mindset, and exposure to industry experts. As a firm committed to advancing healthcare through early-stage innovation, Turret Capital sees this as a unique opportunity to invest in technology and education.
shortSummary: Turret Capital launched The Foundry, a global innovation platform for young innovators, aims to foster and foster talent for healthcare, through competitions and education programs.

scraped_sources.text:
Turret Capital’s global initiative dedicated to identifying, supporting, and nurturing the next generation of bold thinkers and problem solvers in healthcare. Turret is deeply committed to empowering youth and advancing education as part of its broader mission to shape the future of healthcare through early investment in talent and ideas
“Looking for the next generation of bold thinkers and innovators to shape the future of healthcare worldwide.”
The Foundry Health Innovation Challenge 2025
The Foundry Health Innovation Challenge is Turret Capital’s signature online competition for students around the world offering them an unprecedented opportunity to address real healthcare challenges while building valuable skills and connections. With substantial prizes, mentorship opportunities, and media recognition, this competition provides a launching pad for the next generation of healthcare innovators.
Who Can Compete
This challenge is open to high school students (grade 9-12) anywhere in the world. Whether you are an aspiring doctor, engineer, scientist or entrepreneur, this is your opportunity to make a meaningful impact on healthcare innovation.
What You Could Win
Award Level |
Prizes |
|---|---|
🏆 First PlaceFoundry Young Innovator Prize |
|
🥈 Second Place |
|
🥉 Third Place |
|
🏅 Top 10 Finalists |
|
🎓 All Participants |
|
How to Participate
Participation consists of a simple five-step process
Sample Challenges
- Improving access to healthcare for underserved populations
- Reducing mental health stigma and increasing support for youth
- Making healthcare more affordable for students or families
- Helping older adults live independently and safely at home
- Optimizing chronic disease management with technology
Important Dates
| Milestone | Date | What Happens |
|---|---|---|
| Applications Open | August 1, 2025 | Registration is open |
| Submission Deadline | December 15, 2025 | Final videos due |
| Late Submissions | January 15, 2026 | Last chance |
| Finalists Announced | February 1, 2026 | Top 10 revealed |
| Finals Competition | March 15, 2026 | Live online pitch event |
| Winners Announced | March 16, 2026 | Champions crowned |
Competition Guidelines
Identify a critical unmet need or pressing challenge in today’s healthcare landscape. Design and propose an innovative solution that meaningfully addresses this issue.
Your solution should aim to achieve one or more of the following:
- Improve patient outcomes
- Enhance the delivery of care
- Expand access to healthcare services
- Reduce overall healthcare costs
Present Your Idea (Part 1)
Pitch Deck
Pitch Deck: A concise and compelling presentation outlining your problem, your solution, target users, implementation strategy and impact. Use our Pitch Deck Template for guidance.
Download Pitch Deck TemplatePresent Your Idea (Part 2)
Video Presentation
A clear and engaging 3-5 minute video that brings your pitch to life - showcasing your understanding of the issue, your creativity and the potential of your solution.
Register NowRules & Registration
How to Submit Your Pitch
| Step | What to Do |
|---|---|
| 1. Create Your Pitch |
|
| 2. Upload and Submit |
|
| 3. Wait for Results |
|
Registration & Pricing
Competition Registration Fees
| Team Size | Total Cost | Cost Per Person |
|---|---|---|
| 1 Person (Solo) | $150 | $150 |
| 2 People | $250 | $125 |
| 3 People | $350 | $117 |
Registration Requirements
- One Entry Per Team of Individual
- Each team or individual may submit only one pitch
- Team Size Limit
- A maximum of three(3) members per team is allowed
- Team Member Details
- All team members must be listed at the time of registration. Changes to team composition after submission are not permitted
- Standard Registration Deadline
- Submit your application by December 15, 2025 to avoid late fees
- Late Registration Deadline
- Late entries will be accepted until January 15, 2026, with a $50 late registration fee per member
How to Register
For Solo Participants
- Complete the registration form with your information
- Pay the $150 registration fee
- Submit your entry according to competition guidelines
For Team Participants
- Designate one team member as the primary registrant
- Complete the registration form including all team member names
- Pay the total registration fee based on your team size
- All team members will receive access to competition materials and updates
Judging Criteria
Pitch presentations will be judged on problem understanding (25%), solution innovation (25%), feasibility (25%), impact potential (15%) and presentation quality (10%) by a panel of judges consisting of investors, entrepreneurs and executives
| Criteria | Weight | What We're Looking For | |
|---|---|---|---|
| Problem Understanding | 25% | Deep knowledge of healthcare challenges | |
| Solution Innovation | 25% | Creative, feasible, scalable ideas | |
| Feasibility | 25% | Realistic implementation plathway | |
| Impact Potential | 15% | Ability to create meaningful change | |
| Presentation Quality | 10% | Clear, engaging communication |
Registration Opens August 1, 2025
Ready to transform healthcare through innovation? The Foundry Global Health Innovation Challenge offers high school students worldwide an unprecedented opportunity to address real healthcare challenges while building valuable skills and connections. With substantial prizes, mentorship opportunities, and recognition from industry leaders, this competition provides a launching pad for the next generation of healthcare innovators.
Questions?
Contact our team: foundry@turretfunds.com

argos_summary: Turret Capital has launched The Foundry, a global innovation platform aimed at empowering young thinkers in healthcare. The initiative kicks off with the Foundry Health Innovation Challenge 2025, an online pitch competition for high school students worldwide, encouraging them to propose innovative solutions to real healthcare challenges. Participants can compete individually or in teams, with opportunities for mentorship, substantial prizes, and recognition in the healthcare industry.
